title: 107_hr1098
content: The "Maritime Policy Improvement Act of 2001" may be cited as such. The table of contents for this Act is provided. The "Maritime Policy Improvement Act of 2001" includes provisions such as vessel COASTAL VENTURE, expansion of American Merchant Marine Memorial Wall of Honor, discharge of agricultural cargo residue, recording and discharging maritime liens, tonnage of R/V DAVIDSON, miscellaneous certificates of documentation, exemption for Victory Ships, and certificates of documentation for various vessels. The Coast Guard Authorization Act of 1996 is amended to include the vessel COASTAL VENTURE. Additionally, there is an expansion of the American Merchant Marine Memorial Wall of Honor. The Congress acknowledges the historical significance of the United States Merchant Marine in serving the country during wars since 1775, including its role in gaining independence and supporting allies in World War II. President Franklin D. Roosevelt and the military are also recognized for their contributions. During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine played a crucial role in supporting the allies, with over 250,000 men and women serving. President Franklin D. Roosevelt and military leaders praised their significant contributions, dubbing them the "Fourth Arm of Defense." During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine, with over 250,000 men and women serving, faced dangers from submarines, mines, armed raiders, and aircraft. At least 6,830 members were killed at sea. During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine faced dangers from submarines, mines, armed raiders, destroyers, aircraft, and kamikaze pilots. Over 6,830 members were killed at sea, 11,000 were wounded, 604 were taken prisoner, and 1 in 32 died in the line of duty. During World War II, the United States Merchant Marine suffered casualties with over 6,830 killed and 11,000 wounded. Additionally, 604 members were taken prisoner, and 1 in 32 died in the line of duty. The Merchant Marine continues to serve the US, upholding the ideals of its former members. The United States Merchant Marine suffered a high percentage of war-related deaths during World War II. The Secretary of Transportation may provide grants to construct an addition to the American Merchant Marine Memorial Wall of Honor in California. The Secretary of Transportation may provide grants to the American Merchant Marine Veterans Memorial Committee, Inc., to construct an addition to the Memorial Wall of Honor in California. The Federal share of the cost will be 50 percent, with an authorization of $500,000 for fiscal year 2002. SEC. 5. DISCHARGE OF AGRICULTURAL CARGO RESIDUE. The discharge of agricultural cargo residue material from a vessel shall be governed by the Act to Prevent Pollution from Ships. SEC. 6. RECORDING AND DISCHARGING MARITIME LIENS. Section 31343 of title 46, United States Code is amended to allow for the recording and discharging of liens on documented vessels under chapter 121. The Secretary is required to record a notice complying with the new regulations. The Secretary is required to record a notice complying with the new regulations for liens on documented vessels under chapter 121. The notice must be accompanied by a declaration confirming the accuracy of the information provided. When presenting a notice to the Secretary for recording under subsection (a), the person with the claim must include a declaration confirming the accuracy of the information provided in the notice. This declaration must also state that a copy of the notice has been sent to the vessel owner and any person with an existing lien on the vessel. When filing a notice for recording, a declaration confirming the accuracy of the information provided must be included. This declaration should also indicate that copies of the notice have been sent to the vessel owner, individuals with existing liens on the vessel, and mortgagees with undischarged mortgages on the vessel. Declarations filed by non-individuals must be signed by authorized representatives. When filing a notice for recording, a declaration confirming the accuracy of the information provided must be included. Declarations filed by non-individuals must be signed by authorized representatives. On full and final discharge of the indebtedness that is the basis for a notice of claim of lien recorded under subsection (b), the lien on the vessel is discharged. The declaration for recording a notice must be signed by an authorized representative. Upon full discharge of the indebtedness, a certificate of discharge must be provided to the Secretary for recording. District courts have jurisdiction over civil actions regarding vessel liens. The person claiming a lien must provide a certificate of discharge of the debt to the Secretary for recording. District courts have jurisdiction over civil actions regarding vessel liens, regardless of the amount in controversy or the parties' citizenship. The person claiming a lien must provide a certificate of discharge of the debt to the Secretary for recording. District courts have jurisdiction over civil actions regarding vessel liens, regardless of the amount in controversy or the parties' citizenship. Venue for such actions can be where the vessel is found, where the claimant resides, or where the notice of claim of lien is recorded. The court may award costs and attorneys fees to the prevailing party, unless justified otherwise. Additionally, a notice of claim of lien recorded under subsection (b) is also addressed. A notice of claim of lien recorded under subsection (b) shall expire 3 years after the specified date. This section does not affect maritime lien laws or defenses, including laches. The section shall expire 3 years after the specified date. It does not change maritime lien laws or defenses. Section 31343 amends notice requirements for recording and discharging liens in title 46 of the United States Code. It also adds a provision to prevent the Secretary from refusing to approve the surrender of vessel documentation based solely on certain grounds. The Secretary cannot refuse to approve surrender of vessel documentation solely because a lien claim has been recorded. Approval may be conditioned for vessels over 1,000 gross tons. Technical correction is made to the Shipping Act, 1916. A notice of a lien claim on a vessel has been recorded under section 31343(a) of this title. The Secretary may condition approval of surrendering the certificate of documentation for a vessel over 1,000 gross tons. Technical correction is made to the Shipping Act, 1916, with an effective date of July 1, 2002. The Secretary of Transportation will determine the tonnage measurement for the small passenger vessel R/V DAVIDSON for regulatory purposes. This measurement applies when the vessel complies with specific requirements. Additionally, there are miscellaneous certificates of documentation addressed in the following section. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like LOOKING GLASS, YANKEE, LUCKY DOG, and ENTERPRIZE for coastwise trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like LOOKING GLASS, YANKEE, LUCKY DOG, ENTERPRIZE, M/V SANDPIPER, FRITHA, PUFFIN, VICTORY OF BURNHAM, and R'ADVENTURE II for coastwise trade. The vessels eligible for certificates of documentation for coastwise trade include M/V SANDPIPER, FRITHA, PUFFIN, VICTORY OF BURNHAM, R'ADVENTURE II, ANTJA, SKIMMER, TOKEENA, and DOUBLE EAGLE2. The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: ANTJA (FL3475MA), SKIMMER (QHG34031D001), TOKEENA (SC 1602 BJ), DOUBLE EAGLE2 (1042549), ENCOUNTER (998174), AJ (599164), BARGE 10 (1101368), NOT A SHOT (911064), PRIDE OF MANY (811529), and AMAZING GRACE (92769). The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: ENCOUNTER (998174), AJ (599164), BARGE 10 (1101368), NOT A SHOT (911064), PRIDE OF MANY (811529), AMAZING GRACE (92769), and SHEWHO (1104094). SEC. 9. EXEMPTION FOR VICTORY SHIPS. Amends Section 3302(l)(1) of title 46, United States Code to exempt the SS Red Oak Victory and SS American Victory. SEC. 10. CERTIFICATE OF DOCUMENTATION FOR 3 BARGES. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation for employment in the coastwise trade for specific vessels, including the former Navy deck barge JIM and the former railroad car barge HUGH. The vessels listed in subsection (b) for coastwise trade are the former Navy deck barge JIM, the former railroad car barge HUGH, and the former railroad car barge TOMMY. These vessels can only be used as floating platforms for launching fireworks. SEC. 11. CERTIFICATE OF DOCUMENTATION FOR THE EAGLE. The Secretary of Transportation will issue a certificate of documentation for the vessel EAGLE for coastwise trade if owned or chartered by a State entity. The vessel EAGLE (hull number BK--1754, United States official number 1091389) can be certified for coastwise trade if owned or chartered by a State entity and meets specific operational criteria. SEC. 12. WAIVER FOR VESSELS IN NEW WORLD CHALLENGE RACE. Beginning April 1, 2002, 10 sailboats in the race can transport guests without payment until 60 days after the race ends or December 31, 2003. SEC. 13. VESSEL ASPHALT COMMANDER may be transferred to a foreign registry or sold to a non-US citizen.
